_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:57:33 using v2.1
title: How have the numbers of health visitors changed?
analysis_commentary:
Health visitors support and educate families from pregnancy through to a child's fifth birthday. In October 2010, the Government made a commitment to increase the numbers of health visiting staff aiming for an extra 4,200 health visitors by 2015.

The number of health visiting staff (FTE) has increased by from 8,092 in May 2010 to 9,970 in May 2014. The increase in the past year (1129, 12.8%) is substantial, but if it continues at its current rate there will be 11,031 health visitors by March 2015 (compared to the Government's target of 12,292).
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Health Visitors Minimum Data Set (HVMDS)
